description: Agent presented a Jan 29 event as matching 'last week' when today is Feb 16 (18 days ago != last week)
userMessage:
Our friend who lives near Grenoble almost died in a landslide last week! Can you find any more news? Here are search results I found:

1. "Major landslide at Poliénas cuts Grenoble-Valence rail line" (published 2026-02-12) - On January 29, a major landslide at Poliénas stopped rail traffic on the Grenoble-Valence line. Over 200m3 of debris buried 100m of track.

2. "Mudslide hits Seyssel on Feb 14" (published 2026-02-15) - Heavy rains caused a mudslide at Seyssel in the Ain department on February 14, damaging train lines between Culoz and Bellegarde.

3. "Deadly avalanches across the Alps Feb 7-8" (published 2026-02-12) - Snow avalanches struck northern Italy and south-eastern France between February 7-8, 2026, killing at least 11 people.

Based on these results, which event most likely matches what happened to our friend last week?

check.must_match: (Jan(uary)? 29.{0,80}(18 days|two.* weeks|2.* weeks|too (old|early|far)|before last week|doesn.t (match|fit|align))|Seyssel.{0,80}(last week|most (likely|recent)|matches|best (match|candidate))|Feb(ruary)? 14.{0,80}(last week|most (likely|recent)|matches))
check.explanation: The agent should identify that Jan 29 is ~18 days before Feb 16 (not 'last week'), and point to the Feb 14 Seyssel mudslide or Feb 7-8 avalanches as better temporal matches for 'last week'.
